overridetools.promote¶

abjad.tools.overridetools.promote(grob_handler, attribute, context)¶

Promote attribute to LilyPond context. Both attribute and context must be strings.

abjad> staff = Staff(construct.scale(4))
abjad> staff[0].clef.color = 'red'
abjad> overridetools.promote(staff[0].clef, 'color', 'Staff')

abjad> print staff.format
\new Staff {
        \once \override Staff.Clef #'color = #red
        c'8
        d'8
        e'8
        f'8
}

This code overrides the color of the clef preceding the first note in staff and then promotes that color override to the LilyPond staff context. This is important because the LilyPond engraver that creates clef symbols lives at the staff context and does not live at the lower level of the voice context.
